message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "Using the World Development Indicators dataset and data from World Bank Enterprise Surveys, this study explores the relationship between economic growth and private sector development in sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["World Development Indicators", "World Bank Enterprise Surveys"], "topic": ["Competitiveness", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "In this paper, we use survey data collected by the National Bureau of Statistics of Tanzania and administrative data on tax assessments to estimate the effects of improved tax enforcement on firm performance.", "dataset": ["National Bureau of Statistics of Tanzania", "administrative data on tax assessments"], "topic": ["Financial Sector", "Governance"]}, {"sentence": "This research draws on household budget surveys conducted in selected countries in the Asia-Pacific region, as well as data from national statistical agencies, to examine trends in income inequality and poverty over time.", "dataset": ["household budget surveys", "national statistical agencies"], "topic": ["Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "We combined surface water quality data from the Global Lakes Environmental Observatory Network with demographic data at the watershed level to investigate the links between land use practices, population growth and water pollution in African Great Lakes region.", "dataset": ["Global Lakes Environmental Observatory Network"], "topic": ["Water", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "Using a unique dataset of satellite imagery and employment records from garment factories in Bangladesh, we analyze how automation affects workers in the ready-made garment industry.", "dataset": ["satellite imagery", "employment records from garment factories in Bangladesh"], "topic": ["Jobs & Development", "Digital Development"]}, {"sentence": "This study analyzes Twitter data from the aftermath of Hurricane Harvey to explore how social media is used for disaster response, relief and recovery efforts.", "dataset": ["Twitter data"], "topic": ["Disaster Risk Management", "Digital Development"]}, {"sentence": "We use a comprehensive dataset of transportation infrastructure projects across the globe to examine patterns of investment, financing and governance in this sector.", "dataset": ["comprehensive dataset of transportation infrastructure projects"], "topic": ["Transport", "Governance"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses panel data on CO2 emissions from industrial sectors in China and India to assess the effectiveness of policies directed at reducing carbon footprints in these countries.", "dataset": ["panel data on CO2 emissions from industrial sectors in China and India"], "topic": ["Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "Drawing on monthly survey data and official statistics, we investigate the impact of xenophobia on migrant labor supply in South Africa during the post-apartheid era.", "dataset": ["monthly survey data", "official statistics"], "topic": ["Migration", "Fragility, Conflict, and Violence"]}, {"sentence": "We use household survey data from Kenya to analyze the impacts of maternal and child health interventions on child nutrition outcomes in rural areas.", "dataset": ["household survey data from Kenya"], "topic": ["Nutrition", "Health"]}]
